statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ -5 \\ -5 \\ 0 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 3 \\ -3 \\ -4 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -2 \\ -6 \\ 5 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 6 \\ -6 \\ 6 \\ 8 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -8 \\ -1 \\ 7 \\ -10 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent or linearly independent.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ -5 \\ -5 \\ 0 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 3 \\ -3 \\ -4 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -2 \\ -6 \\ 5 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 6 \\ -6 \\ 6 \\ 8 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -8 \\ -1 \\ 7 \\ -10 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent .
